Company: AdminaStar Federal, Inc.
Description: AdminaStar Federal, Inc. agreed to pay the United States $6 million to resolve allegations that the company interfered with Medicare evaluations and overcharged the federal healthcare program.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division

Company: Amerigroup Corporation
Description: Amerigroup agreed to pay $225 million to settle allegations that it systematically avoided enrolling pregnant women and unhealthy patients in the Medicaid managed care program it was paid to operate in Illinois.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division

Company: Amerigroup Corporation
Description: After it disclosed conduct to the Office of Inspector General pursuant to its Corporate Integrity Agreement, Amerigroup Corporation agreed to pay $30,754.93 for allegedly violating the Civil Monetary Penalties Law by contracting with three individuals that it knew or should have known were excluded from participation in Federal health care programs and paid for prescriptions written by a fourth individual that it knew or should have known were excluded from participation in Federal health care programs.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General

Company: Anthem, Inc
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 52411: Direct Life, Health, and Medical Insurance Carriers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: Anthem Insurance Companies
Description: Anthem Insurance Companies agreed to pay the United States $1.5 million to settle allegations that the company overcharged the Federal Employee Health Benefits Program.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division

Company: Anthem Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Connecticut, Inc.
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Agency: National Labor Relations Board
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Company: Anthem Insurance Company & BCBSMA & BCBSRI & BCBSVT
Primary Offense: Medicare Parts C and D Enforcement Action
Description: improper contract administration
Agency: Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services

Company: Freedom Health Inc.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division

Company: HealthSun Health Plans, Inc.
Primary Offense: Medicare Parts C and D Enforcement Action
Description: improper contract administration
Agency: Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services

Company: RightCHOICE Managed Care, Inc.
Description: RightCHOICE Managed Care, Inc. agreed to pay the United States $975,000 to settle allegations that it violated the False Claims Act in connection with providing health care benefits to federal employees and their dependents in the state of Missouri. The settlement resolved allegations that RightCHOICE overcharged the Federal Employees Health Benefits (FEHB) Program, which is administered by the U.S. Office of Personnel Management.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division

Company: Wellpoint, Inc.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 524114: Direct Health and Medical Insurance Carriers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: WellPoint Health Networks
Description: Blue Cross of California (BCC) and its parent company WellPoint Health Networks agreed to pay the United States $9,250,000 to resolve allegations that BCC, which had a contract with the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services to process Medicare claims in California, knowingly falsified data regarding its performance of cost report audits.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division

Company: Amerigroup New York
Description: overtime violation
Private Litigation Case Title: Bijoux et al v. Amerigroup New York, LLC

Company: Amerigroup Corporation
Description: overtime violation
Private Litigation Case Title: Toure v. Amerigroup Corporation et al

Company: Anthem, Inc.
Primary Offense: Medicare Parts C and D Enforcement Action
Agency: Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services

Company: Wellpoint, Inc.
Anthem, Inc.
Description: Anthem, Inc. agreed to pay $16 million to the Office for Civil Rights and take substantial corrective action to settle potential violations of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) Privacy and Security Rules after a series of cyberattacks exposed the electronic protected health information of almost 79 million people.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office for Civil Rights

Company: WellPoint Inc.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office for Civil Rights

Company: Amerigroup Illinois and Amerigroup Corp
Description: Amerigroup Illinois and Amerigroup Corp. were found guilty of systematic and extensive Medicaid fraud, by illegally avoiding paying for medical care for pregnant women and people with expensive health conditions while receiving state and federal funds. The companies were initially ordered to pay $144 million; in March 2007 the final was set at $334,365,000. In August 2008 Amerigroup agreed to pay $225 million to settle the matter. The case was also reported by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-amerigroup-corporation
Agency: Illinois Attorney General
Notes: The proportions that the state, federal government, and whistleblower recieved are not noted.

Company: Blue Cross of California dba Anthem Blue Cross
Agency: California Attorney General

Company: Empire HealthChoice
Agency: New York Attorney General

Company: WellPoint Inc.
Description: failure to report a data breach
Agency: Indiana Attorney General
Info Source: Attorney General Reaches Settlement with Wellpoint in Consumer Data Breach; Insurer Will Pay $100,000 Over Private Data Accessible on Public Web Site, States News Service, July 5, 2011 (via Nexis).

Company: WellPoint, Inc.
Description: To resolve a case involving allegations of unfair health insurance reimbursement rates, WellPoint agreed to pay $10 million to a qualified nonprofit organization that would establish a new, independent database to help determine fair out-of-network reimbursement rates for consumers throughout the United States.
Agency: New York Attorney General

Company: Anthem Blue Cross
Description: Anthem Blue Cross agreed to pay $6 million to resolve a lawsuit alleging that it unlawfully rescinded coverage of patients after they filed claims.
Agency: Los Angeles (CA) City Attorney
Info Source: LA settles health insurance lawsuit for $6M, Associated Press, June 21, 2013 (via Nexis).

Company: Anthem Inc.
Description: The California Attorney General announced an $8.69 million settlement against Anthem, Inc., resolving allegations that the health insurance provider violated consumer protection and privacy laws arising from a 2014 data breach. California's settlement, reached in parallel with a related multistate settlement (see separate entry), includes injunctive terms that require Anthem to make changes to its information security program and remedy the vulnerabilities that permitted the data breach.
Agency: California Attorney General
